intro: Vanieria crenata, commonly known as the sea hake or sea hakegrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is a perennial grass that thrives in coastal and brackish environments, often found in tidal zones and salt marshes. The plant has slender, wiry stems with small, narrow leaves that are adapted to withstand saline conditions. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically appearing in early spring. Vanieria crenata plays a role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial organisms.
